column5: You have my unwavering support and prayers Ryan.

See you guys are beyond awesome!  Definitely helped to read through your stories that ended well and to have so many positive outlooks.  Everything you read online seems to point to a negative outcome... not a good thing to google this sort of stuff.  I'm currently burying myself in house and office work to sort of take my mind off it a little and to make sure we have everything taken care of and in order before Tuesday.  We have a fair bit of stuff to get done before then as we weren't expecting the little one so soon.  I was trying to get my basement finished and my new office up and running so Claira could take over my current office and would have a nursery, but apparently she's impatient just like her mom...  I will get back to you guys individually as soon as time permits.  Thank you once again OFC - this place truly is one of a kind.  Thanks again and have a great sunday afternoon!  Ryan and Family
You'll have lots of support here Ryan.  Keep the faith.  JF
Wow, Ryan...just want to let you know that Juli and I are sending our prayers for you!  I'm not a religious person either, but, wish all of you the best!!
Thoughts sent your way. Good luck
Positive thoughts and prayers sent your way.... best of luck and keeping the positive energy going.  All the best.
My thoughts go out to you and your family.
Hey Ryan,  I'll be thinking about you this week fella.  You take care and all will come out well.  RJ
Best and most sincere thoughts going out from my family!

Hi Ryan  I haven't been on OFC for weeks (on a course)...anyway....this morning with the crazy weather I drove myself in a little earlier....and decided to take a peek here.  Baby Claira is lonesome.  She hears you all and she wants to join her family.  All will be well.  And I will be praying for her and thinking of you all including your Grandmother.

Thanks guys! Nanny's in the hospital right now, just waiting to hear how everything goes... we have a bunch of stuff to finish off and get sorted and ready before tomorrow.  All of your thoughts and time that you put into sending us PM's and stories of happy endings are priceless and very much appreciated.  Thanks!  Ryan & Family

Keep your head up & stay positive, it's much better in the long run, positive vibes to you & yours, I have a son who had a Triple By-Pass the day after his 8th Birthday, he'll be 25 in May POSITIVE POSITIVE POSITIVE POSITIVE SBK

Dang Ryan I missed this over the weekend as I was not on the puter but thought something was up when reading the follow up post I am truly glad to know the outcome of this.  Thoughts are still heading your way for your Grand mother

You know my thoughts Ryan, as we talked before I left.... and you know the story of our "lost baby" that is currently doing her Masters in Architecture at Waterloo.  Hope all went well yesterday and all are doing FINE !  Wayne

Ryan, If anything/everything I googled/read on line was true, I wouldn't be here today to reply to your post. Stay positive & strong for your loved ones. Good things happen to good strong people. God Bless, Simon/Slayer

With the excitement and hopes that the gang does well at the Tyler event this weekend I hate to start something up that's on a lower note, but I could use some positive reinforcement or energy sent my way right about now.  I typically try to keep personal things in my life detached from OFC as although I do consider very many of you my friends, even some whom I've never met, at the end of the day this is still a public forum.  The board has done huge things for me such as hook me up with Dave Mercer... that lead to the job I have now, which allows me to provide for my family. Also, for the past two years my Fish-a-Thon has been a huge success largely thanks for the folks of OFC.  For this I thank you guys more than you can imagine, but I need one more favor.  We have a new baby girl who was due to arrive in our lives sometime next month, and up until Thursday everything was going smoothly.  Ginny went in for an ultrasound and to the doctor's shock Baby Claira hadn't gained the weight they expected.  The only reason they did the ultrasound was because she was breach a few months ago.  Now although she isn't breach anymore, she's under weight and they're concerned that something is wrong, so they're going to induce early labor and get her out on Tuesday.  The doc's are going to have a special care unit in the room on standby in case they need to rush her out and take care of her.  There's a good chance that she'll be just fine, but the doc's have to tell us the worst case scenerio's as well.  I don't really know where I'm going with this....It's just been tough to concentrate the past couple of days.  My wife is doing better since finding out and we're optimistic that everything will be a-ok but if anybody has been though something like this and has positive feedback please feel free to throw it my way.  I've already spoken privately to one member who's helped me think positive about all of this.  I'm scared, but hopeful and excited to meet my baby girl on Tuesday.  To top it all off my grandmother "Nanny" has since gone in for a routine checkup and they "found something".  So they scheduled emergency surgery for monday morning, where they plan to remove said "something" and do a biopsy on it.  If all goes well she'll be in the hospital for 5 days then released, and hopefully said growth isn't something to worry about in the future.  Unfortunately I won't be able to visit her as I'll be 6 hours away in the hospital with Ginny and Claira.  Anyways - I've had better days, and am looking forward to getting the next few days over with.  High hopes and lot's of love to my family is all I'm concentrating on right now.  And I guess a little venting on OFC.  As for my favor.. if you took the time to read my ramblings and maybe think about us for a few seconds...thanks  Many of you are enjoying the ice - but I'm only a month away from soft water fishing on Erie   .  Until then - fishing is taking a back seat.  Cheers and Thanks for reading.  Ryan, Ginny, Averie, Luke and Baby Claira
Hey Ryan Great post and positive thoughts definitely coming your way....keep up the great work and remember, family always comes first! cheers..everything will be okay... Rich

Thats a rough spot to be in for sure bud. But asking for a little support and prayer is never a tall request. Keep your chin up and stay positive, sometimes life may throw you a curve but remember its not always gonna be a strike. Let it pass and wait for the next pitch.  We'll keep you guys in our prayers here.
Sorry to hear that Ryan postive thoughts for your baby Claira!
Praying for you and your family Ryan!  Keep your chin up!
Were here for ya Ryan.. Ill pm ya a little story about our special little girl!! You met her at the fishathon!

Hang tough Ryan! 9 mnths. ago my father was diagnosed with colon cancer. They removed  the bad stuff, now he is cancer free had results from catscan yesterday.  I was born 2 mnths. early 40 yrs. ago. weighed 4lbs. 4oz. at birth. Spent most of my life at 5'11" and 200 lbs.   Good news will happen, have faith in it. Stay strong.

Hey Ryan, very sorry to hear the news    I've never been through this and trying to think of some words to say to make you feel better but unfortunately I'm out of words..... only thing I can do is to keep you and your family in my thoughts and prayers.  Hope all goes well on Tuesday Jacques

Hey Ryan, some couples try to have children and can't. You and Ginny have been blessed so far there's no reason why it wouldn't continue.  I've got 5 children, the last one, Helene was born at 24 weeks...that was 29 years ago on the 20th of January. She weighed 1.5 pounds. Considered almost a lost cause back then at that age. This was at the Royal Victoria Hospital in Montreal. My wife and I were at the hospital til Helene was able to leave. I slept there for 2 months. There were a lot of other children in the same neo-natal care unit and lots didn't make it for a bunch of reasons. The biggest reason I think was that some parents would just visit the child once in a while for 30 minutes or and hour. You have to stay with them! Put the gown on, stick your hands in the incubator, touch them and talk to them. Sounds suckie I know but I believe that. I can speak volumes on this stuff but this is not the place to do it.  Good luck to you and Ginny.
Your family will be in my prayers. Hang tight and by the grace of Almighty you will be through.
Ryan...  Just had a talk with my Higher Power to ask for help for you and yours...  Cheers Mate
Done Ryan. everything will work out fine.

DUDE!  I really feel for ya! you still have my number?  feel free to give me a call.  when my daughter was born she wasn't breathing and was .5 seconds away from being a code blue birth.  we can chat if you want Ryan. Geoff

All the good thoughts I can muster up are coming your way Ryan. And just so you know, talking about your worries is a good thing, even if you've never met many of the folks you're talking to, just like your doing here.  Things will be OK
Hey buddy thinking about you guys hope everything is A-OK like you said.  Roy there's nothing "sucky" about loving your children no matter what it takes.
Prayers sent your way Ryan. Please keep us updated.
Off the ice now and yes like Norm said,I too have sent my prayers.I have been saying alot of them latley another for you and your family cant hurt.

Good luck Ryan.  I'll have you in my thoughts the coming weeks.  It's been a rough go for lots of us these past few months.  Something in the air a I guess.  Some people slam the OFC, saying it's nothing but a hug fest here.  Well, sometimes even tough    fisherman need hugs!
Wish you and your family the best. Keep us updated.

Ryan: Letting it all out like this will do you and your family wonders thru all this. To carry these fears by yourself is a heavy burden for anyone let alone a young family.  Prayers from our family to yours.  Sincerely,  The Hunter Family
Thinkin of you guys
Prayers and thoughts going your way, keep the faith. Doctors and Hospitals today are capable of amazing work today.
Stay strong...we're pulling for you.
All the best to you and your family.  Do your best to stay positive and positive things will follow.
Geez Ryan, I feel your anguish through this post.  I'll definately be putting some positive energy and thoughts your way.  I'll bet everything will be just fine.  Keep us updated.  Joey
